p: Radix Astragali (RA), the root of Astragalus membranaceus var. mongholicus (Bunge) P.K. Hsiao or A. membranaceus (Fisch.) Bge. is often used in traditional Chinese medicine. It was classified as top grade in Shennong Bencao Jing ( Shennong’s Materia Medica Classic), which means adverse side effects from the medicine material are uncommon and can be taken for a long time. It has been widely used in foods, teas, drinks, wines, cosmetics, and so on ( Guo et al., 2018). In fact, according to the statistics, RA is used in more than 192 Chinese medicine prescriptions and over 1,045 kinds of health products ( Cheng et al., 2019). In recent years, RA is also increasingly consumed by the global market beyond China. The global consumption of RA is vast, for example, 4,477.17 tons of RA have been exported from China in 2015 ( Wang et al., 2018).
